tidbits.title: Ancient Silk Road
tidbits.description: Turkmenistan was a key stop on the ancient Silk Road, with historic cities like Merv and Nisa, recognized as UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

tidbits.title: Gas Reserves
tidbits.description: The country has significant natural gas reserves, and the 'Door to Hell,' a natural gas field in Derweze, has a perpetually burning crater known as the 'Gates of Hell.'

tidbits.title: Cultural Heritage
tidbits.description: Turkmenistan showcases a blend of Turkmen, Persian, and Soviet influences in its art, music, and architecture, reflecting its diverse cultural heritage.
